title: No-One But You (The Vishanti Venture)
body:
by starkyoukai

Hello and welcome to the Vishanti Venture. This is a sequel to the story I wrote that is called No-One But You (Only The Good Die Young)

It specifically follows the Vishanti trio. Tony Stark, Dr. Stephen Strange, and Steve Rogers. If you haven’t read the first fic, haven’t reached the part in the story with the Vishanti, or if don’t know what that is in the Marvel Universe, please don’t fret.

I will provide you a fic that really doesn’t need the previous one. It will stand alone. There will be explained references, but I will provide context. The end of the first fic really leaves the three main characters in a world and a journey that is completely separate. I’m working on my fiction writing so feedback is always greatly appreciated.

This continuation or “sequel” takes place a year and six months after the last chapter.

Words: 2193, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of No-One But You

summary: So, Im a pussy bitch. Thats why this is anon. I come in peace. I have a question. Do most starker shipers change the age of...
question: So, Im a pussy bitch. Thats why this is anon. I come in peace. I have a question. Do most starker shipers change the age of Peter? Or do they just... not?
answer:
Peter’s age is up for interpretation, just like anything when it comes to fiction. We can make it what we want or we can leave it as it is. That’s the fun of it. Personally, I either keep him his canon age or I age him up slightly depending on what it is I’m writing.

But I can’t really answer for everyone. We all do our own thing, and honestly I rarely pay attention to how old he is in people’s writing. For me it’s mainly about their chemistry ☺️

summary: College stony prompt: Steve and Tony go to the farmers market, Tony has to ore and is forced to use a portapotty
question: College stony prompt: Steve and Tony go to the farmers market, Tony has to ore and is forced to use a portapotty
answer:
Bathroom disasters (a stony fic)

(Here you are anon! It’s short and cringe because I wrote this in a hurry but I hope this meets ur expectations! Also, no beta read so sorry for mistakes!)

“Steeeve…Steeve, I have to pee…” Tony whines, tugging against the sleeve of Steve’s woolly sweater.

They’re at the monthly farmers market, getting whatever they need to make a lovely pot roast for their college’s Thanksgiving pot-luck this year. Steve has a tote bag full of vegetables while Tony’s carrying a fresh basket of eggs for breakfast tomorrow morning.

“I told you to pee before we left.” Steve rolls his eyes, glancing at a stand displaying some eggplants.

“And I did, I swear Steve I did!”

“Oh you did?” Steve nonchalantly says and uses a pen to cross something off on his list. “Then it’s probably that chocolate milkshake you had a few minutes ago.”

“Oh yeah, right. Well I need to pee. I really need to pee Steve…”

“We can’t just go home now, Tones, and even if we could you’d probably wet your pants before we’d even have the chance to get on the subway.”

One glance at Tony and you can tell that he’s undergoing serious discomfort.

The brunette starts wiggling and laces his fingers into Steve’s, squeezing a bit too tightly. “I gotta go, I gotta go…Steeve, I can’t hold it in anymore.”

“Hang on,” Steve pulls them to a nearby stand where a kind looking middle aged woman is selling pumpkins and spices. “Hello m’am, do you know if there are any bathrooms in the vicinity? My boyfriend really has to pee,” Steve politely asks.

The woman smiles instantly, pointing them in the direction of a little blue cabin. “Of course, there’s a portable toilet right there behind that fruit stand.”

Steve nods and shoots her a toothy grin and a thank you before rushing Tony to the porta potty. “Here give me the basket and go pee before you make a fool out of yourself.”

Tony’s face scrunches up in disgust. “No…I don’t wanna use a porta potty, Steve, you know what happened last time,”

Steve shivers, remebering that time Tony had used a porta potty and flushed the toilet, only to come out soaking in dirty water. “Baby, I know you hate it but you really don’t have a choice.”

“And look!” Tony tries to lock the door. “It doesn’t even close! What if someone walks in on me?”

“Tony, pleas just go, I’ll guard the door and I’ll even flush the toilet if you’re to scared to.”

“Really?”

The blond nods. “The things you do for love.”

Tony is quick to relieve himself, quickly getting out of the stall and leaving a toilet full of urine for Steve to flush. Luckily for him, he doesn’t come out soaked in feaces.

“See? That wasn’t that bad.” Steve hands Tony his basket of eggs.

“My night in shinning armor, saving the the day yet again.” Tony reaches to cup Steve’s face with his hands but the latter just jerks away.

“Nope, you’re not touching me with your pee-pee hands.”

The cons of using a porta potty: half of them don’t even have sinks.

“What? I touch you with pee-pee hands all the time, in fact, I kiss you with a pee-pee mouth every time I get on my knees and-“

“Tony! We’re in public!” Steve whisper shouts but he fails to hold back a snort and a grin. “You’re gonna be the death of me.”

“I love you too.”



💙Got a prompt? lemme know!❤️

“We can’t just go home now, Tones, and even if we could you’d probably wet your pants before we’d even have the chance to get on the subway.”

One glance at Tony and you can tell that he’s undergoing serious discomfort.

The brunette starts wiggling and laces his fingers into Steve’s, squeezing a bit too tightly. “I gotta go, I gotta go…Steeve, I can’t hold it in anymore.”

“Hang on,” Steve pulls them to a nearby stand where a kind looking middle aged woman is selling pumpkins and spices. “Hello m’am, do you know if there are any bathrooms in the vicinity? My boyfriend really has to pee,” Steve politely asks.

The woman smiles instantly, pointing them in the direction of a little blue cabin. “Of course, there’s a portable toilet right there behind that fruit stand.”

Steve nods and shoots her a toothy grin and a thank you before rushing Tony to the porta potty. “Here give me the basket and go pee before you make a fool out of yourself.”

Tony’s face scrunches up in disgust. “No…I don’t wanna use a porta potty, Steve, you know what happened last time,”

Steve shivers, remebering that time Tony had used a porta potty and flushed the toilet, only to come out soaking in dirty water. “Baby, I know you hate it but you really don’t have a choice.”

“And look!” Tony tries to lock the door. “It doesn’t even close! What if someone walks in on me?”

“Tony, pleas just go, I’ll guard the door and I’ll even flush the toilet if you’re to scared to.”

“Really?”

The blond nods. “The things you do for love.”

Tony is quick to relieve himself, quickly getting out of the stall and leaving a toilet full of urine for Steve to flush. Luckily for him, he doesn’t come out soaked in feaces.

“See? That wasn’t that bad.” Steve hands Tony his basket of eggs.

“My night in shinning armor, saving the the day yet again.” Tony reaches to cup Steve’s face with his hands but the latter just jerks away.

“Nope, you’re not touching me with your pee-pee hands.”

The cons of using a porta potty: half of them don’t even have sinks.

“What? I touch you with pee-pee hands all the time, in fact, I kiss you with a pee-pee mouth every time I get on my knees and-“

“Tony! We’re in public!” Steve whisper shouts but he fails to hold back a snort and a grin. “You’re gonna be the death of me.”

“I love you too.”

title: [untitled Ironstrange excerpt]
body:
Note: May be largely offline for the next 36 hours, so I don’t think I’ll be able to finish this over the weekend, but I wanted to put something up anyway. For the bingo square “Water,” but I’m not going to tag the bingo folk for this until the whole thing is done.

I am running very late for my out-of-town bus so…posting this now and apologizing in advance for any typos or continuity/grammatical errors. This will highly likely be edited before it gets finished and goes into AO3.

***


Tony wasn’t warned that when the sorcerer “died,” he was going to haunt Tony’s dreams.

“…Well, that’s creepy,” were Tony’s first words upon finding out. “Could’ve told me earlier you can do that.”

“It was a last-minute sort of thing,” was the vague, quiet explanation.

“Does that mean you’re not really dead?”

“It means I’ve found a way to escape being completely banished from this reality,” Stephen calmly explained. “I wouldn’t call it ‘not dead,’ as I don’t have a body anymore. I’m still technically around, I’m just not able to interact with anything outside of the dream dimension.”

Tony blinked. “The what now?”

“The dream - “ Wrong approach. He had to make it simpler. “- okay, your dream, specifically. A couple of people’s dreams.”

"You mean I’m not the only one who enjoys this special privilege?” Tony asked with a hefty dose of sarcasm, folding his arms across his chest.

“No,” Stephen answered, deadpan. “I can visit a few other humans. Other sorcerers. There’s Wong, for example - you remember him?”

“Course I remember,” Tony snapped. “He was the one of the only two wizards I know who didn’t let Thanos waste half the universe.”

Stephen paused. A small, frustrated sigh escaped him.

“You’re still sore about that…”

“Yeah, no shit,” Tony replied. “Since you can go bother other people, why don’t you go ahead and do that?”

“I need to talk to you, Tony.”

“Yeah, well, tough.” Tony scowled. “I’m in a life-or-death situation outside of this dream, and I doubt anything you tell me can make a difference.”

Tony’s spite burned, but was far from unforgiving.

There was still a flicker in his eyes, which asked Why? Why did you do it? Why me?

It told Stephen that Tony needed time.

"Don’t worry,” Stephen assured him. “you’ll forget we ever talked when you wake up.”

Before Tony could ask what he meant, he vanished, leaving Tony to see the rest of his dream through.

***

But time was something Stephen didn’t have in abundance. He had to hurry it along somehow.

He had to set the scene.

The last time they spoke, in the real world, Tony was in a broken ship, with a daughter of Thanos, millions of light years away from Earth.

The barely-moving derelict’s supplies were running out. The daughter of Thanos, not human, could barely understand Tony’s need for human contact at that bleak, desperate moment.

All this, Stephen learned by observing Tony as he dreamed of soft beds, cheeseburgers, coffee, friends’ laughter, and the warm embrace of the woman he wanted to marry.

In the dream dimension, Stephen couldn’t see into Tony’s thoughts, but he could see Tony’s desires and fears.

Tony was afraid he wouldn’t see Earth again.

Deathly afraid.

Knowing that helped Stephen figure out what to do.

So the next time he and Tony spoke, it was in the premises of a cozy lakeside cabin, facing out into the water.

The house wasn’t familiar to Tony. Not yet. But when he materialized on the porch in his dream, he took to the place instantly.

“I see you’ve redecorated,” he remarked, clearly impressed. “This place isn’t bad.”

“You should know, you chose it.” Stephen caught himself and added, “Well…will choose it. And it isn’t actually you, but Ms. Potts who’ll be doing the choosing. It’ll take you the better part of a year to warm up to it, but you’ll get there.”

Tony said nothing. He was looking out into the placid water. Stephen looked out of it, as well.

“This was - is - will be - your favorite spot.”

“Has anyone ever told you how weird you are?”

Stephen didn’t miss the acid in Tony’s voice. But he chose to ignore it.

“Think of this as a vacation house. A place where you can recover.” He continued slowly, “I know that I left you in a…difficult place.”

Tony snorted. “A difficult place” was a hell of a euphemism for “floating in space with fast-depleting resources and no hope of rescue.”

“You need your strength, so it’s important that you rest,” Stephen said, with undisguised warmth. “We’ll have time to talk later.”

Tony could have had a comeback to that, but he was tired…so tired. He was often tired in real life, but he couldn’t disguise it in his dreams.

And the man who walked his dreams, who could see what he hid inside of them, left him quietly to recuperate.


[tbc]

blog.description:
Don’t even know why I have this blog

23

Trash Artist

Trash Author

Literally Trash, don’t throw me away pls Take me out maybe?

Whore for a lot of imaginary characters

Would love to write

body:
‘Sup Loosers. Jump in. Summer‘s here

“Have you ever had sex?” Tony asked and looked at Loki. Grinning, he watched Loki turn red in his face and hid it behind his book. “Seems to be a no. Do you want to give it a try?” Tony asked, “Certainly not.“, Loki returned. "What? How can you miss such a chance? That’s the most exciting thing in the world. Imagine…” “No. I certainly don’t imagine anything. Can’t you keep your terrible thoughts for yourself even once?” Loki asked and closed his book so loudly, that even Clint was startled at the next table.

“What did I miss?” he asked in wonder and looked around. “Go back to sleep.” Tony laughed. “See you tonight for the barbecue.” Loki said goodbye and left the library. “You did good, Stark.”, said Natascha. “What do I have to do with it, if the princess is so uptight?” Tony asked and looked at the redhead. “You know how he is. In front of Steve you don’t make jokes like that all the time,” Bruce said. “What is he not doing in front of me?“ Steve asked and sat next to Bruce. "Hey Steve. Tony had to get on Loki’s nerves again.” Natascha said. “Where is my brother?” Thor asked and looked around. “Probably on his way home,” Tony explained. “Then I better catch up with him, otherwise he’ll have to run. See you tonight, friends?” asked the blonde with a smile. “Of course, keep the beer cold.” Tony grinned, Thor nodded and jogged out of the library. “How can these two be related?”, Tony asked and drove through his hair.

“Today you’re particularly tiring again, has anyone ever told you that?” Clint asked and drove through his face. “Not today yet. Would you like to do me a favor?” Tony asked laughing. “Is there finally quiet here? This is still a place of peace and quiet,” hissed the librarian and looked at Tony angrily. “Excuse me, Miss Bloom. He’ll be as quiet as a mouse from now on. I promise.” Steve smiled. “Good. Otherwise, you’re welcome to go.” Nodded the old woman and left the table.

“Old witch.” Tony grumbled.

“She’s right. I’m leaving now, too. Clint, will you come with me?”, Natascha asked and packed up her things. “Of course,” he nodded and also admitted everything. Together they disappeared from the library. “Should I take you with me later?”, Tony asked and looked at Steve and Bruce. “Bucky picks me up. He’s probably waiting for me,” Steve said. “All right. Should I take you with me, Bruce?” Tony asked, “If that’s not too much of a detour for you, I’d love to,” Bruce nodded. “All right,” nodded Tony.

At 19 o'clock the friends met in front of Thor’s house. “But we’re not the only ones now, are we?” Natascha asked. “I think Thor invited more people,” Steve said. “I hope so. I don’t want to be in the same room with his parents. You know my allergy to parents,” laughed Tony, “At some point, maybe not today or tomorrow, but at some point in our life, this man will grow up,” said Natascha. “You have too much hope Tasha,” Clint laughed. “I know,” grinned the redhead. “If you stand out there any longer, you’ll grow roots,” Loki’s voice sounded from the front door. Tony looked at him and swallowed inconspicuously. Normally Loki looked really good. The black-haired guy was one of the few students who could wear the school uniform. But now? That was a walking sin. “Are you coming?” Natascha asked and pulled him out of his thoughts. “Hm? Yes, sure,” Tony nodded and followed his friends. “Good to see you,” Natascha greeted the younger man. “Me too. You look good,” Loki smiled. “I can only return the compliment. Is there any special occasion?” she asked with a smile. “No. That’s how I dress normally ” Loki smiled. “We should meet much more often,” Natascha laughed and entered the house. “Stark.” Loki nodded and looked at him with his poisonous green eyes. “Loki,” said Tony smiling. “My brother is waiting for you.” Loki said and closed the door behind Tony. “Why?” Tony asked… “His… friends don’t believe him that there is another creature next to him on this planet that can empty several bottles in a row without getting alcohol poisoning directly,” Loki said and rolled his eyes. “All right. Then I’ll show these people how good I am,” Tony laughed and disappeared into the garden.

“Good morning, darling,” his mother smiled at him. “Mother… good to see you. When did you come back?” Thor asked surprised.

“This morning. Your father had a heart attack when he saw the garden. You should have breakfast and help him clean up,” Frigga smiled. “Of course. Let me just find something for the headaches,” Thor nodded carefully. Every movement hurt. “Morning…” yawned Volstagg and sat down at the kitchen table. “Good morning,” Fandral greeted her. “Hm…” Sif sat down and dropped his head on her arms. “Good morning, Miss Odinson,” Hogun smiled. “Please be quieter…” moaned Fandral. “Don’t you have a hangover,” Volstagg complained. “Good morning to all of you,” Frigga smiled and distributed the plates. “Where is your brother?“ "He’s probably still asleep. He was still awake at three when we went to bed,” said Thor.

Please”, Tony smiled and pulled Loki by his hips, between his legs. Loki wrapped his arms around Tony’s neck and looked down at him. “You explain this to my family,” he murmured before Loki bent down and kissed him.

Together they went down the stairs. “My parents are already there,” Loki said. “Should I rather disappear,” Tony asked worriedly. “No. You just have to pass Thor,” Loki smiled and pulled him into the kitchen. “Loki, my darling. Good to see you. And Tony. Thor hadn’t even mentioned that you would spend the night here,” Frigga smiled. “Yes… Good morning first,” Tony laughed nervously. Thor looked at them both and recognized the intertwined hands. “Before you kill us, brother. Leave it alone. There is nothing to discuss,” Loki noted dryly and sat down on the chair. He briefly pulled his face, but it was only Tony who noticed it. He laughed quietly and sat down next to him. “It’s nice that my sons are finally all happy,” Frigga smiled. “Not for long. How did you manage to destroy the whole garden within one evening? Please, don’t answer this question. I can answer it myself. Frigga, my heart. Can I have a coffee, please? I don’t think my back can take it anymore,” Odin said and sat at the head of the table. “Of course, my dear,” Frigga smiled and put the cup in front of Odin.

While Odin and Frigga unpacked their clothes, Thor, his friends, Loki and Tony disappeared in the garden to eliminate the chaos.

“Which of you idiots threw up in the pool, please?” rumbled Thor. “That was you, my dear Thor. After Tasha had made you one of her well-known mixtures,” Tony laughed and hit Thor on the shoulder. “Never again,” grumbled Thor. “What? The party or Natasha’s mix?” Loki smiled and picked up a plastic cup. “Both. Brother, you are the sensible one of us. Please hold me off next time,” said Thor, looking desperately at his younger brother. “If only you would listen to me,” Loki said and continued stuffing cups into the garbage bag.

Together they cleaned up the garden as quickly as possible. And when the lawn was free of garbage and the vomit had disappeared from the pool, they all sat down on the benches and loungers. “So you had sex yesterday,” Sif grinned and looked at Tony, then at Loki. Loki twisted his eyes. “Sif. I beg you,” Thor said. There would be a lot more discussions, Loki knew that. “What? I want to know! The ice princess has finally melted. How many people tried it at home and all failed. Either on you or they froze to death in the vast ice desert in which Loki’s heart lies,” Fandral said. “Fandral, I beg you. Don’t make these comparisons. I certainly wasn’t an ice princess,” Loki twisted his eyes. “Oh no? And how would you describe yourself?” the blonde grinned. “Please no more Elsa jokes”, laughed Tony. “Elsa?” Loki looked at him confused. “You never saw Frozen? Oh baby, you really missed something,” grinned Tony. “I hate all of you,” Loki twisted his eye.

The day ended as well as it had begun. Loki was happy. Thor hadn’t killed anyone and Tony was the pure definition of love. So and no other way, the rest of his life would begin. Tony swore that to himself.

Summary:

“In the midst of Tony carrying out his responsibilities as an Avenger, the workings of the entire planet had suddenly changed in an instant. The date had been August 13, 2017. It was on a Sunday morning, that Tony had woken up in his hotel suite in Goa, with a searing pain in his left wrist. A pain so intense, that it had rivalled having his chest cut open in Gulmira.” Soul bonds AU which is in line with canon. Tony, Steve and Bucky share a soul mark. Steve and Bucky are aware of theirs; Tony hides his. But then something happens to Loki during IW, and everything changes once again.
